courses.title: Elementary Chinese I
courses.description: Introduction to listening, speaking, reading, and writing in Chinese (Mandarin) and to the culture of Chinese-speaking regions.

courses.title: Elementary Chinese II
courses.description: Continued listening, speaking, reading, and writing in Chinese (Mandarin) with further study of the culture of Chinese-speaking regions.

courses.title: Accelerated Elementary Chinese I
courses.description: This is the first of two courses in the basic Chinese sequence geared for heritage learners at the elementary level. The pace is approximately 30% faster than the non-accelerated course.

courses.title: Chinese for Heritage Learners I
courses.description: For heritage students in the U.S. who have never studied Chinese formally, but who speak some Chinese without being able to read or write it. Taught in Chinese.

courses.title: Intermediate Chinese I
courses.description: A rapid review of grammar with continued use of listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills in Chinese (Mandarin), all with a cultural emphasis.

courses.title: Intermediate Chinese II
courses.description: This course focuses on listening, speaking, reading, and writing skills in Chinese (Mandarin) in an introduction to literature and within a cultural context.

courses.title: Accelerated Intermediate Chinese I
courses.description: This is the first of two courses at the intermediate level in the Chinese sequence geared for heritage learners. The pace is approximately 30% faster than the non-accelerated course.

courses.title: Chinese For Heritage Learners II
courses.description: For intermediate-level heritage students in the U.S. who can communicate some in Chinese, but cannot read or write it for academic purposes. Taught in Chinese.

courses.title: Internship Assistantship
courses.description: Modern Language Undergraduate Internship for pay for freshmen and sophomores, by permit only. The internship experience must be at a unit or agency approved by the School of Modern Language.

courses.title: Undergraduate Internship
courses.description: Modern Language Undergraduate Internship for credit for freshmen and sophomores, by permit only. The internship experience must be at a unit or agency approved by the School of Modern Languages.

courses.title: Intermediate Chinese III
courses.description: Continued reinforcement of basic speaking, reading, and writing skills, and cultural knowledge to enhance students' communication ability in topics relating to contemporary life and Chinese society.

courses.title: Advanced Chinese I
courses.description: Continued reinforcement of intermediate speaking, reading, and writing skills, and cultural knowledge to enhance students' communication ability in topics relating to contemporary life and Chinese society.

courses.title: Chinese Society and Culture I
courses.description: Comprehension and discussion of issues in contemporary Chinese culture.

courses.title: Chinese Society and Culture II
courses.description: Comprehension and discussion of Chinese news, economic reports, political events, feature stories, and sports on television and in newspapers.

courses.title: China: A Cultural Odyssey
courses.description: Key aspects of culture and highlights of Chinese civilization: philosophy, arts and architecture, belief systems, family relationships, historical periods, social changes, technological innovation. Taught in English.

courses.title: A Kaleidoscope of Chinese Language
courses.description: Explores the Chinese language from multiple perspectives, examining its multifaceted and intriguing interactions with society, culture, gender, music, politics, and media. Taught in English.

courses.title: Chinese for Current Events
courses.description: Reading, discussion and analysis of intermediate/advanced current events texts and authentic media. Part of the intensive summer Chinese language program (LBAT). Admission by application only.

courses.title: Business Chinese
courses.description: Acquisition of business technology, protocols, decorum strategies and improvement of oral communication skills. Reading and writing of notes, correspondence, and reports. Part of the summer language program (LBAT). Admission by application only.

courses.title: Conversation Practicum (LBAT)
courses.description: Language practicum in the local community with written and oral classroom presentations.  Part of the intensive summer Chinese language program (LBAT).  Admission by application only.

courses.title: Economic Development and Sustainability in China
courses.description: Examines the world's most populous nation's assault on its environment and resources in the pursuit of rapid economic growth.  Taught in Chinese.

courses.title: Special Topics
courses.description: Permits a group of students and a professor to pursue areas of the Chinese language not extensively treated in other courses in the department.

courses.title: Advanced Chinese II: Contemporary China

courses.title: Advanced Chinese III: Contemporary China
courses.description: Further development of advanced communication abilities. Materials deal with the economic, cultural, social, and political changes in contemporary China.  Taught in Chinese.

courses.title: Advanced Chinese Grammar
courses.description: This course will build on students' command of Chinese grammatical structures to enhance their spoken and written performances in academic setting. Taught in Chinese.

courses.title: Advanced Language, Popular Music and Culture
courses.description: Utilizing popular songs/videos as cultural texts, this advanced language and culture course develops the students' listening, reading, writing, presentation, and web-based research in Chinese.

courses.title: Kungfu Fiction/Pop Cul
courses.description: Utilizing authentic kungfu fiction texts, this advanced language and culture course develops students' listening, reading, writing, presentation, and web-based research, all in Chinese.

courses.title: Chinese Strategy & The Art of War
courses.description: Using classical texts and their modern Chinese translations, this advanced language course analyzes Chinese strategic language and thought, with Western cultural comparison. Taught in Chinese.

courses.title: Chinese-Language Cinema: Technological, Cultural, and Urban Transformation in China
courses.description: Utilizing selected Chinese films as texts, this advanced Chinese course analyzes and discusses the technological, cultural, and urban transformation in China.

courses.title: Kungfu and Wuxia Film and Pop Culture
courses.description: Utilizing authentic film texts, this advanced language/culture course develops the students; listening, reading, writing, presentation, and web-based research abilities and skills in Chinese.

courses.title: A Documentary Survey of Sino-American Interactions
courses.description: This course seeks to foster students' understanding of how Sino-U.S. interactions over history have shaped the perspectives of the other culture. Taught in Chinese.

courses.title: Advanced Intercultural Seminar
courses.description: Integrates cross-cultural research and reflection into discussion of current issues in the Chinese-speaking world.  Intended for students who have had some study-abroad experience in China.  Conducted in Chinese.
